title: Accidental shooting at gun show injures two

SANDY, Utah (ABC4 Utah) - An accidental shooting, believe it or not, at a gun show in Sandy.
It happened at the Crossroads of the West Gun Show at the South Towne Expo Center. Sandy police say a customer wanted to check out a Colt 45 from a dealer. He took the zip tie off, noticed it had a loaded magazine, took that out, but didn't realize there was still a bullet in the chamber.
Sgt. Dean Carriger, of the Sandy Police Department, told us, “He pointed the gun down at the floor and pulled the trigger, discharging the firearm. Luckily the round struck the floor and ricocheted into a pillar and stopped. Unfortunately the bullet fragments went outward and struck two individuals a 17 year old male and a 13 year old female.
They suffered only minor injuries. Sergeant Carriger says no charges will be filed, but he reminds everyone to treat every gun as if it is loaded.
